author.name: Æthelred the Skald
author.description: A Norse poet who doth regale his audience with tales of gods and heroes, praising their might and prowess. He references Norse mythology and history in his poems. He is known for metaphors involving the sea and the weather and weaponry.

newsMedieval:
Lo! The dragon of smoke, of flame's brethren in slumber,
British American, with hoard now torn asunder.
Upon pyre of gold, a sacristy dwindling,
For brands of combustion, new wyrm songs are kindling.

In the land of the Danes, the longship's tether unveiled,
Against short anchor lines, pearl's worth assailed.
Danske the Seer speaks of bargains abound,
At yearend's market, where treasures are found.

Hark! Clariant, the mirth of the mead-hall dims,
With closure of vine, from where sweet nectar streams.
Of harvest's bounty in Romania fallow,
Cuts deep the forecast, groweth shadows long and shallow.

feedItems.title: British American Tobacco Sees £25 Billion Impairment on U.S. Brands Pressure
feedItems.description: British American Tobacco said it expects a one-off impairment of around £25 billion this year due to market pressure on some of its combustibles brands in the U.S. as it tries to increase revenue from nontraditional tobacco products.

feedItems.title: Danish Long-End Bonds Look Cheap Vs Short-End Peers
feedItems.description: Long-end government bonds on the Danish curve look cheap relative to the short end, Danske Bank Research said ahead of Denmark’s last bond auction this year on Wednesday.

feedItems.title: Clariant Sees Lower Earnings on Bioethanol Plant Closure
feedItems.description: Clariant will close a bioethanol plant in Romania, and said it would also downsize related activities in Germany, cutting its earnings forecast for 2023 as a result.

author.name: Conchobar mac Dubhthach
author.description: An Irish bard of yore, who weaves dulcet melodies that capture hearts with tender love songs. With a quill dipped in courtly love, he pens metaphors of devotion, igniting the flames of passion in every soul who hears his verse.

newsMedieval:
An order's fall, as deep and clear as sorrow's tear,
From German forges stripped of might, bereft of cheer.
Forsooth, the manufacturing song is low, I fear,
A signal strong that wait we must, a rebound's near.

TUI 'mongst the mirth and gold, a vision bright,
Their coffers crammed with gleaming yield from the night.
A winters' tale of bookings, on an upward flight,
Foreseeing growth of ten-fold measure, to heart's delight.

The USD/JPY's melody, a lonesome tune,
A downward dance 'neath the watchful eye of the moon,
As charted by Oanda, under a twilight's gloom,
Foretells the trend's continuity, intact as June's bloom.

feedItems.title: German Manufacturing Orders Fall More Than Expected
feedItems.description: New orders at German factories were 3.7% lower in October, a further signal that any rebound in the country’s struggling manufacturing sector will have to wait.

feedItems.title: TUI Sees Continued Profit Growth
feedItems.description: TUI reported a net profit for fiscal 2023 and said it expected revenue for the year ahead to grow at least 10%, as winter 2023-24 bookings were up 11%.

feedItems.title: USD/JPY's Short-Term Downtrend Still Intact, Charts Show
feedItems.description: USD/JPY’s short-term downtrend is still intact, based on technical analysis, Oanda said.

author.name: Brother Arnulfus
author.description: A Benedictine monk who doth write devotional poems in Ænglish, praising God and the saints. His poems are often humorous, short, and satirical. They often contain metaphors of alcohol, especially wine or ale.

newsMedieval:
A noble proposition doth WHSP extend,
To make fair Perpetual its dearest friend.
An offer sweet as honeyed mead in a barrel,
Worth a gracious sum, no petty quarrel.

Lo' the Nikkei soars, a phoenix in the night,
With gains broad and certain, bringing much delight.
'Tis a hearty ale, brewed just right,
Rising in strength with each market fight.

Ah, the merry music of coin's sweet jingle,
As YG shares with Blackpink's contract mingle.
Like a toast raised high on the eve of a song,
The shares rise in value, flying strong and long.

feedItems.title: WHSP Proposes Takeover Valuing Perpetual at A$3.06 Billion
feedItems.description: Australian investment house Washington H. Soul Pattinson proposed a takeover of Perpetual in a deal valuing the wealth manager’s equity at about US$2.00 billion.

feedItems.title: Nikkei Rises 2.0% Amid Broad-Based Gains
feedItems.description: The Nikkei Stock Average rose 2.0% to close at 33445.90, marking its biggest one-day advance since mid-November.

feedItems.title: Blackpink's Contract Renewal Sends Shares of K-Pop Label YG Soaring
feedItems.description: YG Entertainment shares surged after the label behind K-pop girl group Blackpink renewed exclusive contracts with all four members of the band.

author.name: Guillemette de Ventadour
author.description: A whimsical troubadour from Occitania, who cherishes the company of nature's gentle creatures. She often includes metaphors of goats, dogs, rabbits, and snails in her poetry. Her writing style is terse.

newsMedieval:
The land 'cross the sea, whose might is sung,
Struggles, a tired beast, to forge its guards,
While eastern dragon's fire breath is flung,
In steel and iron, midst the silent bards.

Upon the world, a change of climate knocks,
In lands where falls the rain, and strife unfurls,
The lowly nations 'neath the mighty's mocks,
Seek aid amidst the deadly water-swirls. 

Venture bold, in gas's fickle fame,
Its path crosses with giants of old lore,
In the dance of power, a bitter game,
Where contracts bear the weight of the unsaid swore.

feedItems.title: The U.S. Can Afford a Bigger Military. We Just Can't Build It.
feedItems.description: America’s industrial base struggles to ramp up defense production while China’s churns out ever more weapons.

feedItems.title: Climate Change Made Their Homes Unsafe. Who Pays for Their Move?
feedItems.description: Developing countries like Uganda, where more rain is causing deadly landslides, will press rich nations at international climate talks for more adaptation funding.

feedItems.title: U.S. Gas Startup at Center of Epic Feud With Global Energy Giants
feedItems.description: Venture Global is becoming one of the world’s biggest natural-gas exporters. Shell, BP and others say it got there by reneging on their contracts.
